allowClaim.description: Indicates whether another user can take ownership of the virtual machine

applicableSchedule.description: The applicable schedule for the virtual machine.

labVmsShutdown.description: The auto-shutdown schedule, if one has been set at the lab or lab resource level.

createdDate.description: The creation date of the schedule.

dailyRecurrence.description: If the schedule will occur once each day of the week, specify the daily recurrence.

time.description: The time of day the schedule will occur.

hourlyRecurrence.description: If the schedule will occur multiple times a day, specify the hourly recurrence.

minute.description: Minutes of the hour the schedule will run.

emailRecipient.description: The email recipient to send notifications to (can be a list of semi-colon separated email addresses).

notificationLocale.description: The locale to use when sending a notification (fallback for unsupported languages is EN).

status.description: If notifications are enabled for this schedule (i.e. Enabled, Disabled).

timeInMinutes.description: Time in minutes before event at which notification will be sent.

webhookUrl.description: The webhook URL to which the notification will be sent.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning status of the resource.

status.description: The status of the schedule (i.e. Enabled, Disabled)

targetResourceId.description: The resource ID to which the schedule belongs

taskType.description: The task type of the schedule (e.g. LabVmsShutdownTask, LabVmAutoStart).

timeZoneId.description: The time zone ID (e.g. Pacific Standard time).

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique immutable identifier of a resource (Guid).

weeklyRecurrence.description: If the schedule will occur only some days of the week, specify the weekly recurrence.

time.description: The time of the day the schedule will occur.

weekdays.description: The days of the week for which the schedule is set (e.g. Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, etc.).

labVmsStartup.description: The auto-startup schedule, if one has been set at the lab or lab resource level.

createdDate.description: The creation date of the schedule.

dailyRecurrence.description: If the schedule will occur once each day of the week, specify the daily recurrence.

time.description: The time of day the schedule will occur.

hourlyRecurrence.description: If the schedule will occur multiple times a day, specify the hourly recurrence.

minute.description: Minutes of the hour the schedule will run.

emailRecipient.description: The email recipient to send notifications to (can be a list of semi-colon separated email addresses).

notificationLocale.description: The locale to use when sending a notification (fallback for unsupported languages is EN).

status.description: If notifications are enabled for this schedule (i.e. Enabled, Disabled).

timeInMinutes.description: Time in minutes before event at which notification will be sent.

webhookUrl.description: The webhook URL to which the notification will be sent.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning status of the resource.

status.description: The status of the schedule (i.e. Enabled, Disabled)

targetResourceId.description: The resource ID to which the schedule belongs

taskType.description: The task type of the schedule (e.g. LabVmsShutdownTask, LabVmAutoStart).

timeZoneId.description: The time zone ID (e.g. Pacific Standard time).

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique immutable identifier of a resource (Guid).

weeklyRecurrence.description: If the schedule will occur only some days of the week, specify the weekly recurrence.

time.description: The time of the day the schedule will occur.

weekdays.description: The days of the week for which the schedule is set (e.g. Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, etc.).

artifactDeploymentStatus.description: The artifact deployment status for the virtual machine.

artifactsApplied.description: The total count of the artifacts that were successfully applied.

deploymentStatus.description: The deployment status of the artifact.

totalArtifacts.description: The total count of the artifacts that were tentatively applied.

artifacts.description: The artifacts to be installed on the virtual machine.

deploymentStatusMessage.description: The status message from the deployment.

installTime.description: The time that the artifact starts to install on the virtual machine.

name.description: The name of the artifact parameter.

value.description: The value of the artifact parameter.

vmExtensionStatusMessage.description: The status message from the virtual machine extension.

computeId.description: The resource identifier (Microsoft.Compute) of the virtual machine.

dataDiskIds.description: Gets data disks blob uri for the virtual machine.

dataDisks.description: Gets all data disks attached to the virtual machine.

items.description: A data disks attached to a virtual machine.

diskSizeGiB.description: Gets data disk size in GiB.

diskUri.description: When backed by a blob, the URI of underlying blob.

managedDiskId.description: When backed by managed disk, this is the ID of the compute disk resource.

networkInterfaceId.description: Gets the network interface ID of the virtual machine.

osDiskId.description: Gets OS disk blob uri for the virtual machine.

osType.description: Gets the OS type of the virtual machine.

statuses.description: Gets the statuses of the virtual machine.

items.description: Status information about a virtual machine.

displayStatus.description: Gets the short localizable label for the status.

message.description: Gets the message associated with the status.

vmSize.description: Gets the size of the virtual machine.

createdByUser.description: The email address of creator of the virtual machine.

createdByUserId.description: The object identifier of the creator of the virtual machine.

createdDate.description: The creation date of the virtual machine.

customImageId.description: The custom image identifier of the virtual machine.

dataDiskParameters.description: New or existing data disks to attach to the virtual machine after creation

items.description: Request body for adding a new or existing data disk to a virtual machine.

attachNewDataDiskOptions.description: Specifies options to attach a new disk to the virtual machine.

diskName.description: The name of the disk to be attached.

diskSizeGiB.description: Size of the disk to be attached in Gibibytes.

diskType.description: The storage type for the disk (i.e. Standard, Premium).

existingLabDiskId.description: Specifies the existing lab disk id to attach to virtual machine.

hostCaching.description: Caching option for a data disk (i.e. None, ReadOnly, ReadWrite).

disallowPublicIpAddress.description: Indicates whether the virtual machine is to be created without a public IP address.

environmentId.description: The resource ID of the environment that contains this virtual machine, if any.

fqdn.description: The fully-qualified domain name of the virtual machine.

galleryImageReference.description: The Microsoft Azure Marketplace image reference of the virtual machine.

offer.description: The offer of the gallery image.

osType.description: The OS type of the gallery image.

publisher.description: The publisher of the gallery image.

sku.description: The SKU of the gallery image.

version.description: The version of the gallery image.

isAuthenticationWithSshKey.description: Indicates whether this virtual machine uses an SSH key for authentication.

labSubnetName.description: The lab subnet name of the virtual machine.

labVirtualNetworkId.description: The lab virtual network identifier of the virtual machine.

lastKnownPowerState.description: Last known compute power state captured in DTL

publicIpAddressId.description: The resource ID of the public IP address.

rdpAuthority.description: The RdpAuthority property is a server DNS host name or IP address followed by the service port number for RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol).

sharedPublicIpAddressConfiguration.description: The configuration for sharing a public IP address across multiple virtual machines.

items.description: A rule for NAT - exposing a VM's port (backendPort) on the public IP address using a load balancer.

backendPort.description: The port to which the external traffic will be redirected.

frontendPort.description: The external endpoint port of the inbound connection. Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive. If unspecified, a value will be allocated automatically.

transportProtocol.description: The transport protocol for the endpoint.

sshAuthority.description: The SshAuthority property is a server DNS host name or IP address followed by the service port number for SSH.

subnetId.description: The resource ID of the sub net.

virtualNetworkId.description: The resource ID of the virtual network.

notes.description: The notes of the virtual machine.

osType.description: The OS type of the virtual machine.

ownerObjectId.description: The object identifier of the owner of the virtual machine.

ownerUserPrincipalName.description: The user principal name of the virtual machine owner.

password.description: The password of the virtual machine administrator.

planId.description: The id of the plan associated with the virtual machine image

provisioningState.description: The provisioning status of the resource.

scheduleParameters.description: Virtual Machine schedules to be created

location.description: The location of the new virtual machine or environment

name.description: The name of the virtual machine or environment

dailyRecurrence.description: If the schedule will occur once each day of the week, specify the daily recurrence.

time.description: The time of day the schedule will occur.

hourlyRecurrence.description: If the schedule will occur multiple times a day, specify the hourly recurrence.

minute.description: Minutes of the hour the schedule will run.

emailRecipient.description: The email recipient to send notifications to (can be a list of semi-colon separated email addresses).

notificationLocale.description: The locale to use when sending a notification (fallback for unsupported languages is EN).

status.description: If notifications are enabled for this schedule (i.e. Enabled, Disabled).

timeInMinutes.description: Time in minutes before event at which notification will be sent.

webhookUrl.description: The webhook URL to which the notification will be sent.

status.description: The status of the schedule (i.e. Enabled, Disabled)

targetResourceId.description: The resource ID to which the schedule belongs

taskType.description: The task type of the schedule (e.g. LabVmsShutdownTask, LabVmAutoStart).

timeZoneId.description: The time zone ID (e.g. Pacific Standard time).

weeklyRecurrence.description: If the schedule will occur only some days of the week, specify the weekly recurrence.

time.description: The time of the day the schedule will occur.

weekdays.description: The days of the week for which the schedule is set (e.g. Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, etc.).

size.description: The size of the virtual machine.

sshKey.description: The SSH key of the virtual machine administrator.

storageType.description: Storage type to use for virtual machine (i.e. Standard, Premium).

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique immutable identifier of a resource (Guid).

userName.description: The user name of the virtual machine.

virtualMachineCreationSource.description: Tells source of creation of lab virtual machine. Output property only.
